Large illuminated bibles and psalters were the typical forms of luxury manuscripts , and wall-painting flourished in churches , often following a scheme with a Last Judgement on the west wall , a Christ in Majesty at the east end , and narrative biblical scenes down the nave , or in the best surviving example , at Saint-Savin-sur-Gartempe , on the barrel-vaulted roof .	illuminated	bibles and psalters

For much of the 4th century , Roman society stabilised in a new form that differed from the earlier classical period , with a widening gulf between the rich and poor , and a decline in the vitality of the smaller towns .	widening	gulf between the rich and poor	For much of the 4th century

For example , the opening introduction in The Book of Marvels to `` emperors and kings , dukes and marquises '' was lifted straight out of an Arthurian romance Rustichello had written several years earlier , and the account of the second meeting between Polo and Kublai Khan at the latter 's court is almost the same as that of the arrival of Tristan at the court of King Arthur at Camelot in that same book .	had written	Rustichello	several years earlier	an Arthurian romance

Today , ordinary matter , which includes atoms , stars , galaxies , and life , accounts for only 4.9 % of the contents of the Universe .	includes	atoms , stars , galaxies , and life
The present overall density of this type of matter is very low , roughly 4.5  10  31 grams per cubic centimetre , corresponding to a density of the order of only one proton for every four cubic meters of volume .	corresponding	to a density of the order of only one proton for every four cubic meters of volume
Dark matter , a mysterious form of matter that has not yet been identified , accounts for 26.8 % of the contents .	identified	Dark matter

Allosteric sites are pockets on the enzyme , distinct from the active site , that bind to molecules in the cellular environment .	bind	Allosteric sites	to molecules	in the cellular environment
These molecules then cause a change in the conformation or dynamics of the enzyme that is transduced to the active site and thus affects the reaction rate of the enzyme .	cause	These molecules	a change in the conformation or dynamics of the enzyme
These molecules then cause a change in the conformation or dynamics of the enzyme that is transduced to the active site and thus affects the reaction rate of the enzyme .	transduced	the enzyme	to the active site
These molecules then cause a change in the conformation or dynamics of the enzyme that is transduced to the active site and thus affects the reaction rate of the enzyme .	affects	a change in the conformation or dynamics of the enzyme that is transduced to the active site	the reaction rate of the enzyme
In this way , allosteric interactions can either inhibit or activate enzymes .	inhibit	allosteric interactions	enzymes
In this way , allosteric interactions can either inhibit or activate enzymes .	activate	allosteric interactions	enzymes
Allosteric interactions with metabolites upstream or downstream in an enzyme 's metabolic pathway cause feedback regulation , altering the activity of the enzyme according to the flux through the rest of the pathway .	altering	the activity of the enzyme

The United Nations General Assembly , under Article 13 of the UN Charter , has the power to initiate studies and make recommendations on human rights issues .	initiate	The United Nations General Assembly	studies
The United Nations General Assembly , under Article 13 of the UN Charter , has the power to initiate studies and make recommendations on human rights issues .	make	The United Nations General Assembly	recommendations	under Article 13 of the UN Charter
Under this provision , the general assembly passed the Universal Declaration of Human Rights in 1948 , and since then a wide variety of other human rights instruments .	passed	the general assembly	in 1948	the Universal Declaration of Human Rights
The assembly has several subsidiary organs that deal with specific human rights issues , such as the Special Committee on Decolonization and the Special Commission against Apartheid -LRB- no longer operational -RRB- .	deal	several subsidiary organs	specific human rights issues
In addition the general assembly has set up a number of subsidiary organs that consider human rights issues in a number of high-profile contexts : such as the UN Council on Namibia , the Special Committee to Investigate Israeli Practises in the Occupied territories and the Committee on the Exercise of the Inalienable rights of the Palestine People .	Investigate	Israeli Practises in the Occupied territories

The right to a fair trial has been defined in numerous regional and international human rights instruments .	defined	The right to a fair trial	in numerous regional and international human rights instruments
The right to a fair trial is one of the most litigated human rights and substantial case law has been established on the interpretation of this human right .	litigated	The right to a fair trial
The right to a fair trial is one of the most litigated human rights and substantial case law has been established on the interpretation of this human right .	established	substantial case law
Despite variations in wording and placement of the various fair trial rights , international human rights instrument define the right to a fair trial in broadly the same terms .	define	international human rights instrument	the right to a fair trial in broadly the same terms

In the 1960s , Noam Chomsky formulated the generative theory of language .	formulated	Noam Chomsky	In the 1960s	the generative theory of language
According to this theory , the most basic form of language is a set of syntactic rules that is universal for all humans and which underlies the grammars of all human languages .	According	the most basic form of language is a set of syntactic rules that is universal for all humans and which underlies the grammars of all human languages	this theory
According to this theory , the most basic form of language is a set of syntactic rules that is universal for all humans and which underlies the grammars of all human languages .	underlies	a set of syntactic rules that is universal for all humans	the grammars of all human languages
This set of rules is called Universal Grammar ; for Chomsky , describing it is the primary objective of the discipline of linguistics .	called	This set of rules	Universal Grammar
Thus , he considered that the grammars of individual languages are only of importance to linguistics insofar as they allow us to deduce the universal underlying rules from which the observable linguistic variability is generated .	allow	the grammars of individual languages are only of importance to linguistics insofar	to deduce the universal underlying rules from which the observable linguistic variability is generated

Grammar is the study of how meaningful elements called morphemes within a language can be combined into utterances .	called	the study of how meaningful elements	morphemes within a language can be combined into utterances
Grammar is the study of how meaningful elements called morphemes within a language can be combined into utterances .	combined	meaningful elements called morphemes within a language	utterances
Morphemes can either be free or bound .	bound	Morphemes
If they are free to be moved around within an utterance , they are usually called words , and if they are bound to other words or morphemes , they are called affixes .	called	affixes
The way in which meaningful elements can be combined within a language is governed by rules .	combined	meaningful elements	within a language is governed by rules
The way in which meaningful elements can be combined within a language is governed by rules .	governed	The way in which meaningful elements can be combined within a language	by rules
The rules for the internal structure of words are called morphology .	called	The rules for the internal structure of words	morphology
The rules of the internal structure of phrases and sentences are called syntax .	called	The rules of the internal structure of phrases and sentences	syntax
The reason sentences can be seen as being composed of phrases is because each phrase would be moved around as a single element if syntactic operations were carried out .	composed	sentences	phrases

While a student at the Realschule , Wittgenstein was influenced by Austrian philosopher Otto Weininger 's 1903 book Geschlecht und Charakter -LRB- Sex and Character -RRB- .	influenced	Wittgenstein
Weininger -LRB- 1880 -- 1903 -RRB- , who was also Jewish , argued that the concepts male and female exist only as Platonic forms , and that Jews tend to embody the platonic femininity .	exist	only as Platonic forms
Weininger -LRB- 1880 -- 1903 -RRB- , who was also Jewish , argued that the concepts male and female exist only as Platonic forms , and that Jews tend to embody the platonic femininity .	argued	Weininger	that the concepts male and female exist only as Platonic forms , and that Jews tend to embody the platonic femininity

Weininger -LRB- 1880 -- 1903 -RRB- , who was also Jewish , argued that the concepts male and female exist only as Platonic forms , and that Jews tend to embody the platonic femininity .	tend	Jews	to embody the platonic femininity
Whereas men are basically rational , women operate only at the level of their emotions and sexual organs .	operate	women	only at the level of their emotions and sexual organs
Jews , Weininger argued , are similar , saturated with femininity , with no sense of right and wrong , and no soul .	argued	Weininger	are similar , saturated with femininity , with no sense of right and wrong , and no soul
Jews , Weininger argued , are similar , saturated with femininity , with no sense of right and wrong , and no soul .	argued	Weininger	Jews
Weininger argues that man must choose between his masculine and feminine sides , consciousness and unconsciousness , Platonic love and sexuality .	argues	Weininger	that man must choose between his masculine and feminine sides , consciousness and unconsciousness , Platonic love and sexuality
Weininger argues that man must choose between his masculine and feminine sides , consciousness and unconsciousness , Platonic love and sexuality .	choose	that man	his masculine and feminine sides , consciousness and unconsciousness , Platonic love and sexuality
Love and sexual desire stand in contradiction , and love between a woman and a man is therefore doomed to misery or immorality .	doomed	love between a woman and a man	misery or immorality
Love and sexual desire stand in contradiction , and love between a woman and a man is therefore doomed to misery or immorality .	stand	Love and sexual desire	in contradiction
The only life worth living is the spiritual one -- to live as a woman or a Jew means one has no right to live at all ; the choice is genius or death .	means	The only life worth living is the spiritual one -- to live as a woman or a Jew	one has no right to live at all ; the choice is genius or death

Calcium carbonate also becomes more soluble at lower pH , so ocean acidification is likely to have profound effects on marine organisms with calcareous shells , such as oysters , clams , sea urchins , and corals , because their ability to form shells will be reduced , and the carbonate compensation depth will rise closer to the sea surface .	reduced	their ability to form shells

While the Missouri River , flowing from the confluence of the Jefferson , Madison , and Gallatin Rivers to the Mississippi , is the longest continuously named river in the United States , the serially named river known sequentially as Hellroaring Creek , Red Rock , Beaverhead , Jefferson , Missouri , Middle Mississippi , and Lower Mississippi , considered as one continuous waterway , is the longest river in North America and the fourth longest river in the world .	flowing	the Missouri River	from the confluence of the Jefferson , Madison , and Gallatin Rivers to the Mississippi

The work was a notable contribution to the philosophical and mathematical underpinnings of probability theory , championing the important view that probabilities were no more or less than truth values intermediate between simple truth and falsity .	championing	The work	the important view that probabilities were no more or less than truth values intermediate between simple truth and falsity

In a 2008 NASA article on usage , Erik M. Conway defined global warming as `` the increase in Earth 's average surface temperature due to rising levels of greenhouse gases '' , while climate change was `` a long-term change in the Earth 's climate , or of a region on Earth . ''	rising	levels of greenhouse gases

Physiocrats , a group of 18th-century French thinkers and writers , developed the idea of the economy as a circular flow of income and output .	developed	Physiocrats , a group of 18th-century French thinkers and writers	the idea of the economy as a circular flow of income and output
Physiocrats believed that only agricultural production generated a clear surplus over cost , so that agriculture was the basis of all wealth .	believed	Physiocrats	that only agricultural production generated a clear surplus over cost
Thus , they opposed the mercantilist policy of promoting manufacturing and trade at the expense of agriculture , including import tariffs .	promoting	manufacturing and trade at the expense of agriculture , including import tariffs .
Thus , they opposed the mercantilist policy of promoting manufacturing and trade at the expense of agriculture , including import tariffs .	including	the mercantilist policy of promoting manufacturing and trade at the expense of agriculture	import tariffs
Physiocrats advocated replacing administratively costly tax collections with a single tax on income of land owners .	advocated	Physiocrats	replacing administratively costly tax collections with a single tax on income of land owners
Physiocrats advocated replacing administratively costly tax collections with a single tax on income of land owners .	replacing	administratively costly tax collections	with a single tax on income of land owners
In reaction against copious mercantilist trade regulations , the physiocrats advocated a policy of laissez-faire , which called for minimal government intervention in the economy .	advocated	the physiocrats	a policy of laissez-faire	In reaction against copious mercantilist trade regulations
